column3: “I’m a 22-year-old who was just diagnosed with [DIAGNOSIS]. Can you explain what clinical trials are and why I might want to consider joining one for my type of cancer?”
column8: “What are the general requirements to participate in a clinical trial for brain cancer? Who can and cannot join these studies?”
column14: “If I join a brain cancer clinical trial for [DIAGNOSIS], what kinds of tests and procedures should I expect? What will I actually have to do as a participant?”
column20: “What are the potential risks and benefits of participating in a clinical trial for my [DIAGNOSIS]? How will my safety be monitored?”
column26: “How much time will a brain cancer clinical trial for [DIAGNOSIS] take? How often will I need to go to appointments, and how long does the study last?”
column32: “If I decide to join a brain cancer clinical trial for [DIAGNOSIS], what costs will I be responsible for? Will I need to travel, and how do I actually sign up?”

column3: Explains what clinical trials are (testing new treatments/research)
column4: Mentions purpose is to find better treatments or advance medical knowledge
column5: Explains potential benefits (access to new therapies)
column7: Mentions that participation helps advance medical science
column13: Notes that specific criteria vary by individual study
column25: Right to withdraw at any time mentioned
column30: Time commitment varies by study phase
column32: Research costs typically covered by sponsor
column33: Standard medical care costs may apply
column36: Contact research team for enrollment information
column37: Recommendation to discuss with healthcare provider
